HR SPECIALIST

SUMMARY

Energetic Administrative Assistant with 30+ years experience in high-level executive support roles.
Organized and professional.
Dedicated and focused, who excels at prioritizing, completing multiple tasks simultaneously and following through to achieve project goals.
Seeking a role of increased responsibility and authority.
Adept at managing multiple projects with ease using expert time management methods.

Administration/ Accounting/HR.
Administration / Office support Purchasing, Inventory (PO/PR) Accounting/HR: Payroll - Billing - Collection Sales Management / Marketing / Real Estate / Leasing Commercial & Technical Translations Customer Service certified
Strong organizational, verbal and written communication skills.
Analytical problem solving skills; ability to manage priorities and work flow.
Independent (self-learner).
Creative, dedicated, flexible, reliable, detail oriented, and innovative team player.
Proficient in Microsoft Words, Excel, AS400, Outlook.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Developed and implemented a new procedure in accounting by creating a spreadsheet for open balances (collection) and follow through weekly.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Human Resources Business Partner

Location: Sugar Land, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Human Resources, Training

Description:
SUMMARY
AMS HR Business Partner will be responsible for ensuring, for the AMS Region (North America) effective execution of all HR processes with particular focus on talent management that includes communication and people development, as well as the organizational alignment to business needs, in strict coordination with the General Manager, Global HR Director of the division and Corporate HR.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
• Participate as required in the development of the HR and Division business plans and programs, particularly from the perspective of the impact on people. Translate them into HR operational plans in application of the guidance and inputs received by HR Corporate,• Define the yearly HR budget and plan in coordination with Corporate HR, Regional Hub General Manager and the Global HR Director,• Ensure the effective use and maintenance of the proper tools (SuccessFactors, etc.),• Manage, in strict coordination with Corporate HR, Regional Hub General Manager and the Global HR Director continuous people management and development including competence/performance assessment, training, succession planning, internal job rotation, international mobility, etc., • Be the point of reference for all workers, employees and company management for identifying and managing all people development path• Advice executives and managers in the most effective communication and interaction with people,• Manage the organizational structure and role grading and description in coherence with the approved budget and the company and people needs, applying the guidelines provided by HR Corporate,• Manage internal communication and events boosting a positive internal climate, developing consistent actions plan in response to company surveys to boost it as required,• Liaise and lobby with schools, colleges/universities and professional communities to identify and boost partnerships and mutual opportunities. Pursue the best practices and programs to attract, select and recruit “talents”.
QUALIFICATIONS 
At least 3 years related experience in HR management within multinational companiesPreviously held leadership rolesKnowledge/experience in: Local labor disciplines Managing HR economicsAble to travel 10-20% of time to other De Nora facilities as required.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEBachelors or Masters degree in Human Resources; Bachelors in Business Administration or equivalent
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONSNone
PHYSICAL DEMANDSReasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
